item.title: Setup A More intelligent OpenWRT Router
item.description: Openssh-Server The default sshd is provided by dropbear, the functionality is not good, so I have to replace it with openssh-server. root@OpenWrt:~# uci set dropbear.@dropbear[0].Port=2222 root@OpenWrt:~# uci commit dropbear root@OpenWrt:~# /etc/init.d/dropbear restart root@OpenWrt:~# opkg install openssh-server root@OpenWrt:~# opkg install openssh-client Configure the OpenSSH: # /etc/init.d/sshd enable # /etc/init.d/sshd start # /etc/init.d/dropbear disable # /etc/init.d/dropbear stop The next time you login will ask you for changing your password, do it and continue for using ssh.
